summary.purpose: Barrel export file that re-exports all symbols from the svg and table asset submodules, providing a unified single-entry point for importing all asset components and functions.
summary.problem_solved: Centralizes and simplifies asset imports by allowing consumers to import SVG status indicator components (RedXSvg, RedXSvg2, GreenVSvg) and table helper functions (sortSvg, emptyFilterSvg, slashFilterSvg, exportToExcelSvg) from a single 'assets' namespace instead of from separate submodules.

internal.why_used: Exports all SVG status indicator components (RedXSvg, RedXSvg2, GreenVSvg) and the SvgProps interface
Exports all table control SVG factory functions (sortSvg, emptyFilterSvg, slashFilterSvg, exportToExcelSvg)

exports.name: RedXSvg
exports.description_one_line: React component rendering a red X icon inside a circle for error/failure indication

exports.name: RedXSvg2
exports.description_one_line: React component rendering a standalone red X icon for close/dismiss actions

exports.name: GreenVSvg
exports.description_one_line: React component rendering a green checkmark icon inside a circle for success/valid indication

exports.name: sortSvg
exports.description_one_line: Factory function creating a sort direction arrow SVG icon with optional 180-degree rotation

exports.name: emptyFilterSvg
exports.description_one_line: Factory function creating a filter state indicator SVG icon with solid or outline variants

exports.name: slashFilterSvg
exports.description_one_line: Factory function creating a slashed filter (no-filter) indicator SVG icon

exports.name: exportToExcelSvg
exports.description_one_line: Factory function creating an export-to-Excel button SVG icon with customizable dimensions

symbols.name: Asset Module Exports
symbols.description_one_line: Aggregated export of all SVG icon components and factory functions from svg and table submodules

details.what_it_does: This barrel export file re-exports all named exports from ./svg and ./table modules. It serves as the primary entry point for the assets module, consolidating all SVG icon components and factory functions into a single namespace. Consumers import from 'akeyless-client-commons/assets' rather than managing imports from individual submodules.

minimal_correct.title: Basic import from assets barrel

extensive_correct.title: Complete assets module usage
extensive_correct.code:
import { // SVG Status Indicator Components RedXSvg, RedXSvg2, GreenVSvg, // Table Control Functions sortSvg, emptyFilterSvg, slashFilterSvg, exportToExcelSvg } from 'akeyless-client-commons/assets'; const DataTable = () => (
Name {sortSvg()} Status
Valid Item
Invalid Item
);

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Importing from submodules when barrel available
incorrect.why_incorrect: While importing from submodules works, it's cleaner and more maintainable to use the barrel export. The barrel pattern centralizes exports and makes refactoring easier. Future reorganization of submodules won't require updating imports if they go through the barrel.
